Title: Director of Practice and Clinical Services
RoleDescription: We have an exciting opportunity for a Director of Practice and Clinical Services to join our team! The Director of Practice and Clinical Services plays a pivotal role in overseeing the operations and leading the practice whilst working closely with the clinical team to drive high standards of care and achieve commercial success. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced and commercially aware Veterinary Surgeon looking to join a supportive practice and to step in to a leadership role.   This is a unique leadership role, that provides the opportunity to combine excellent veterinary care with efficient practice management, geared towards the continued improvement of our team and clinic.   Key Responsibilities  Provide leadership, support, guidance, and development opportunities for our team, while working closely alongside the Area Director. You will conduct staff appraisals, resolve queries, and support the growth and progression of the team. You will have knowledge of company policies and financial protocols. Together with the Area Director and Leadership team you will aim to enhance practice performance, achieve financial targets, and communicate changes and updates effectively to the team. Creating a positive and supportive culture and work environment is essential to this role.  Fix or flex  work life balance that work for you This is a full-time role however we are happy to consider flexible working options. Our flexible approach to rota patterns and working hours truly tips the scale on your work life balance. We know that everyone has demands and priorities outside of their career and we want to make it easy for you to strike the right balance.   Our practice and location We are a first opinion small animal practice based in Worcestershire, with our main site in Upton Upon Seven and a smaller, fully equipped branch in Lower Wick, Worcester. Our Upton Upon Severn site is situated in an old GP surgery, with ample parking and a large reception with separate dog and cat waiting areas. There are two consulting rooms and a nurse clinic room. There are also separate dog, cat, and isolation kennels. All clinical areas have pipped oxygen, with dedicated prep, theatre, and diagnostic rooms.  We have a wide range of modern diagnostic equipment, including an inhouse lab, digital x-ray (including dental), laparoscopy, endoscopy, and ultrasound. Our Lower Wick site has a dedicated theatre and separate prep room with an inhouse lab. All our clinical staff are given access to the practices Vet CT subscription. Both sites are within easy reach of the M5 and M50 motorways, with good links to Birmingham airport, the Malvern Hills and the Cotswolds.  Our Wonderful Team  Our team of six vets has over 85 years of experience between them. Half of our vet team have been with us for ten years or longer. We strive very hard to look after our staff; we focus on maintaining a very good work life balance and a positive working environment. Two of our vets hold certificates in medicine and feline practice. We actively support and fund the pursuit of certificates and there is ample case variety to get casebooks done.  We have seven fully qualified nurses, one ANA's and 8 support staff. We are also a nurse training practice and many of our students go on to stay with us as RVNs. Heres what the team have to say about Stocks Working with the team at The Stocks has been a fantastic experience. For me, the roller coaster ride of going from locum vet to partner/owner vet to CD and back to vet has been challenging, but deeply rewarding! Now theres the chance for a new driven vet to pick it all up and run further with it- you will have the opportunity to go as far as you want or are capable of -it's up to you. Whether you want to push your surgical skills, get involved in training the team, help run the practice or whatever, you will be supported by our amazing team.
